member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3File.UpdateMetadata
member.summary: Updates the exists and modified date

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3PathEventArgs
member.summary: Class to allow modifying the bucket and key request path

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3PathEventArgs.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of S3PathEventArgs for modifying the bucket and key of incoming requests

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3PathEventArgs.AssertBucketMatches(System.String[])
member.summary: Stops the request if it doesn't match one of the allowed buckets. Amazon S3 is case-sensitive. Thus, comparisons are case sensitive as well. To minimize headache, a different exception is thrown when only case differs.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3PathEventArgs.ThrowException
member.summary: Throws an HTTP 403 Not Authorized exception. Call this if an invalid bucket request comes through.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3PathEventArgs.ThrowInvalidCaseException
member.summary: Like ThrowException, but hints that the bucket casing is wrong.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3PathEventArgs.PrefixBucket(System.String)
member.summary: Prefixes the specified bucket to the requested path.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3PathEventArgs.Path
member.summary: Path contains the bucket and key in the form "bucket/key". Where key may contain additional forward slashes.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3PathEventArgs.Bucket
member.summary: Parses the bucket from Path

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3PathEventArgs.Key
member.summary: Parses the key from Path

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3Reader2.Uninstall(ImageResizer.Configuration.Config)
member.summary: This plugin can only be removed if it was installed as an IVirtualImageProvider (vpp="false")

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3Reader2.S3Client
member.summary: Configure AWS access keys

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3Reader2.RequireImageExtension
member.summary: (default true) When false, all URLs inside the PathPrefix folder will be assumed to be images, and will be handled by this plugin. You should still use image extensions, otherwise we don't know what content type to send with the response, and browsers will choke. It's also the cleanest way to tell the image resizer what kind of file type you'd like back when you request resizing. This setting is designed to support non-image file serving from the DB. It will also cause conflicts if PathPrefix overlaps with a folder name used for something else.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3Reader2.UntrustedData
member.summary: (default: false) When true, all requests will be re-encoded before being served to the client. Invalid or malicious images will fail with an error if they cannot be read as images. This should prevent malicious files from being served to the client.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3Reader2.CacheUnmodifiedFiles
member.summary: (default true). When true, files and unmodified images (i.e, no querystring) will be cached to disk (if they are requested that way) instead of only caching requests for resized images. DiskCache plugin must be installed for this to have any effect.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider
member.summary: Allows clients to request objects located on another amazon S3 server through this server. Allows URL rewriting.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.FilterPath(System.String)
member.summary: Execites the PreS3RequestFilter event and returns the result.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.#ctor(Amazon.S3.AmazonS3Client,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.RewriteBucketAndKeyPath,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create and configure a virtual path provider.
member.param: Provide the authentication and ecryption settings. For public buckets, no settings are required. Use AmazonS3Config.CommunicationProtocol=HTTP for best performance.
The virtual folder to allow client access of s3 from.
You should validate that the requested bucket is your own. If you only want one bucket, just prefix your bucket to the path.

If true, existence of bucket and key is assumed as long as prefix is present. Also, no modified date information is provided to the image resizer, so the cache never gets updated. Requires 1 request instead of 2 to download the image.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.IsPathVirtual(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a specified virtual path is within the virtual file system.
member.returns: true if the virtual path is within the virtual file sytem; otherwise, false.

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.PreS3RequestFilter
member.summary: Important! You should handle this event and throw an exception if a bucket that you do not own is requested. Otherwise other people's buckets could be accessed using your server.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.VirtualFilesystemPrefix
member.summary: Requests starting with this path will be handled by this virtual path provider. Should be in app-relative form: "~/s3/". Will be converted to root-relative form upon assigment. Trailing slash required, auto-added.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.MetadataAbsoluteExpiration
member.summary: Existence and modified date metadata about files is cached for, at longest, this amount of time after it is first stored.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.MetadataSlidingExpiration
member.summary: Existence and modified date metadata about files is cached for this long after it is last accessed.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.S3Client
member.summary: Gets and sets the AmazonS3Client object that specifies connection details such as authentication, encryption, etc.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.S3Reader2.S3VirtualPathProvider.FastMode
member.summary: If true, existence of bucket and key is assumed as long as prefix is present. Defaults to true. Also, no modified date information is provided, so the cache never gets updated. Requires 1 request instead of 2 to download the image.

members.member: Since we can't watch S3. If you want to invalidate the cache through code or sql, modify this class. For the ASP.NET cache, not the image resizer disk cache.
